RelationshipElement.name: AboveBelow
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a above below for contexts.

RelationshipElement.name: Same As
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a same as for contexts

RelationshipElement.name: Bonded To
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a bonded to for contexts

RelationshipElement.name: ContextArtefactGroup
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N between context and its artefact groups

RelationshipElement.name: ContextSample
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N between context and its artefact groups

ArchaeologicalElement.name: Context
ArchaeologicalElement.description: The physical result of any single action, whether it leaves a positive or negative record within the stratigraphic sequence. (MoLAS 1994)

property.name: Site Code
property.description: Short code to signify the excavation site and often the year of excavation.

property.name: Context ID
property.description: Unique number or code for each Context.

property.name: Context Name
property.description: Brief name for the Context, eg 'House A - west wall'

property.name: AreaCode
property.description: Area or Trench: the working subdivision of an archaeological site.

property.name: Grid Location Reference
property.description: Reference number for the grid square(s) within which this Context falls.

property.name: Excavated By
property.description: The initials or names of individuals who excavated the Context.

property.name: Date Opened
property.description: Date on which the Context was first excavated.

property.name: Excavation Method
property.description: Method and conditions of archaeological excavation.

property.name: Context Type
property.description: Deposit, cut or 'other' (feature).

lookup.term:
{Cut}
Any Context which forms a negative interface, eg pits, ditches, graves and foundation and robber trenches

{Feature}
Any context formed independent of a Cut or negative interface, eg walls, hearths.

property.name: Context Comments
property.description: Additional comments on the description of the Context.

property.name: Soil Compaction Type
property.description: The type of compaction of sediments in the deposit, eg 'Compact', 'Cemented' or 'Loose'.

property.name: Soil Compaction Description
property.description: Description of the compaction of soil, including changes throughout the deposit.

property.name: Soil Colour
property.description: Simple description of the colour of the soil.

property.name: Soil Munsell Colour
property.description: The Munsell Code for the soil colour.

property.name: Soil Grain Size
property.description: Grains which comprise more than 10% deposit should be included here.

property.name: Soil Texture
property.description: Proportions of different grain sizes within the deposit.

lookup.term:
{Clay}
Clays are tough and can be moulded into shapes when moist. Clays form a long flexible ribbon when rubbed between the palms and the ribbon can often be bent into a "U" shape without breaking. Clays dry into very hard clods. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{Clay_Loam}
More easily moulded into a shape than a loam, a clay loam rolls out to a thin ribbon between the palms while a loam will break-up. When dry a clay loam will form a lump but is not as tough to break as a clay. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{Loam}
A loam breaks into crumbs but will tend to stick together. Sand grains cannot be felt in a moist sample which when squeezed will retain its shape when handled freely. Loams are usually soft to the feel. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{Loamy_Sand}
In a loamy sand particles barely stick together and a moulded piece of soil just holds its shape. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{Sand}
A sand has a loose gritty feel and does not stick together. Individual sand grains can be seen or felt. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{Sandy_Clay}
A sandy clay is like a clay but sand grains can be felt (and heard - see Sandy Loam). (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{Sandy_Clay_Loam_}
A sandy clay loam is like a clay loam but sand grains can be felt (and heard - see Sandy Loam) (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{Sandy_Loam}
A sandy loam sticks together more than a loamy sand but can be easily broken. Individual sand grains can be felt and heard if a wet sample is rubbed between the index finger and thumb and held close to the ear. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{Silty_Clay}
A silty clay is like a clay but smoother. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{Silty_Clay_Loam}
A silty clay loam is like a clay loam but silty as well and smooth to the touch. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{Silty_Loam}
A silty loam is like a loam but has a smooth silky feel when a moist sample is pushed between the index finger and thumb. On drying a sample can form a hard lump but this may be broken by hand. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

property.name: Soil Particle Sorting
property.description: Assessment of the frequency with which particles of the same size occur.

lookup.term:
{Moderately_sorted}
Particles are mostly the same size and evenly distributed, but there are some larger particles.

{Poorly_sorted}
Particles are different sizes and unevenly distributed.

{Very_poorly_sorted_}
Particles are very different sizes and very unevenly distributed.

{Well_sorted}
Particles are roughly the same size and evenly distributed.

property.name: Soil Stoniness
property.description: This is a measure of the size, shape and roundness of individual stones present.

property.name: Soil Stone Size
property.description: Give an estimate of the size range of stones present in the Deposit: for example, 20mm -50mm.

property.name: Soil Stone Shape
property.description: Shape and roundness of stones and pebbles in the deposit.

property.name: Deposit Inclusions
property.description: Brief description of inclusions (eg stone flecks, artefacts).

property.name: Deposit Thickness and Extent
property.description: Brief description of the thickness and extent of the deposit.

property.name: Horizon Boundary
property.description: Boundary to the next horizon

lookup.term:
{Clear}
Change occurs over a distance of 25-60 mm. (MoLAS 1994: 35)

{Diffuse}
Change occurs over a distance of 60-130 mm. (MoLAS 1994: 35)

{Irregular}
The boundary surface has pockets that are deeper than they are wide. (MoLAS 1994: 35)

{Sharp}
Change occurs over a distance of 5-25 mm (or less). (MoLAS 1994: 35)

{Smooth}
The boundary surface is plane with few irregularities. (MoLAS 1994: 35)

{Wavy}
The boundary surface has broad shallow relatively regular pockets. (MoLAS 1994: 35)

property.name: Shape of Cut
property.description: The shape at the top of the cut.

lookup.term:
{Linear}
Straight sided, but not square or rectangular.

{Rectangular}
Two sides longer than the other.

property.name: Shape of Cut - Note
property.description: Additional notes about the shape of the cut.

property.name: Shape of Corners
property.description: The shape of the corners of a Cut in plan: 'square', 'rounded' etc.

property.name: Length
property.description: Length of the longest side, in mm.

property.name: Width
property.description: Width or diameter, in mm.

property.name: Depth
property.description: Depth or Height, in mm.

property.name: Break of Slope - Top
property.description: The degree with which the top surface of the edge of the cut breaks into the sides.

lookup.term:
{Not_perceptible}
Well-rounded; there is no perceptible difference between the sides of the cut and the surface into which it protrudes.

property.name: Sides of Cut
property.description: Describe the smoothness, regularity and shape of the sides of a cut (eg 'vertical', 'convex', 'concave' or 'stepped').

property.name: Break of slope - Base
property.description: The degree with which the sides break into the base of the cut.

lookup.term:
{Not_perceptible}
Well-rounded; there is no perceptible difference between the sides of the cut and the surface into which it protrudes.

property.name: Shape of Base
property.description: The shape of the base of the cut, in profile.

property.name: Orientation
property.description: Orientation of linear cuts, eg N-S.

property.name: Inclination of axis
property.description: Inclination of the axis of post- and stakeholes.

property.name: Truncation
property.description: Describe the nature of truncation to the cut (where appropriate).

property.name: Your Interpretation
property.description: Your Interpretation of the likely functional zone of the context, whether inside a structure, or part of the structure itself.

property.name: Your Discussion
property.description: Elaborate upon your basic interpretation.

property.name: Your description
property.description: Enter a simple descriptive interpretation. For example, is it a floor, midden, brickearth wall, gully or pit?

property.name: Start date
property.description: Start Date (may also include time and/or have fuzzy limits)

property.name: End date
property.description: End Date (may also include time and/or have fuzzy limits)

property.name: Phase From
property.description: The earliest phase in which this Context was likely to have been created.

property.name: Phase To
property.description: The latest phase in which this Context was likely to have been deposited or sealed.

property.name: Associations
property.description: Structures, phases or people with which this Context may be associated, eg '1810 cottage'.

property.name: Recorded By
property.description: The name or initials of the person completing the record.

property.name: Sketch
property.description: Sketch

property.name: Photo
property.description: Photo

ArchaeologicalElement.name: Artefact Group
ArchaeologicalElement.description: The total group or assemblage of objects recovered from a single Context. These are sometimes referred to as 'Bulk Finds'.

property.name: Site Code
property.description: Short code to signify the excavation site and often the year of excavation.

property.name: Context ID
property.description: Unique number or code for each Context.

property.name: Artefact Group ID
property.description: Unique number or code for the artefact group.

property.name: Artefact Class
property.description: Broad Artefact Class for each Artefact (eg Glass, Ceramic, Building Material).

property.name: Artefact Quantity
property.description: The number of sherds in this group.

property.name: Artefact Weight
property.description: The total weight (in grams) of all sherds in this Group.

property.name: Artefact Group Comment
property.description: General comment about this group of Artefacts from this Context, eg 'Lots of early porcelain. Few marks.'

ArchaeologicalElement.name: Sample
ArchaeologicalElement.description: Deposit samples, or samples of building elements, recovered from this Context for the purpose of further analysis, or ongoing reference.

property.name: Site Code
property.description: Short code to signify the excavation site and often the year of excavation.

property.name: Context ID
property.description: Unique number or code for each Context.

property.name: Sample ID
property.description: The unique code or reference for the Sample.

property.name: Sample Type
property.description: The type of Sample collected, eg Soil, Wood, Pollen.

lookup.term:
{Building_Materials}
Sample of bricks or worked stone collected from this Context.

{Soil}
General collection of soil deposit from the Context.

{Wood/Charcoal}
Collection of wood or charcoal fragments from the Context.

property.name: Collection Method
property.description: Method of collecting the sample.

lookup.term:
{Hand_collection}
Hand sample of building elements, for example.

{Unsterilised}
A collection using standard excavation tools into a sterilised container.

property.name: Sample Weight
property.description: Weight (in grams) of the sample collected.

property.name: Sample Comments
property.description: Additional comments about this sample, or its collection.
